answers.answerTextLong: Sleep problems usually cause some difficulties getting a full night of sleep.
Daytime sleepiness occurs, but I can resist and I stay awake.
These feelings cause a lot of problems, but they do not stop me from doing things or being with other people.
I have been constipated. I use extra effort to move my bowels. However, this problem does not disturb my activities or my being comfortable.
Sleep problems are present but usually do not cause trouble getting a full night of sleep.
These feelings cause some problems when I do things or am with other people.
Constipation causes me to have some troubles doing things or being comfortable.
Sleep problems cause a lot of difficulties getting a full night of sleep, but I still usually sleep for more than half the night.
Sometimes I fall asleep when alone and relaxing. For example, while reading or watching TV.
I have these feelings. However, I can do things and be with other people without difficulty.
This survey is part of a clinical trial and the detailed results are not available to patients.
